'''Arantar''' ([[Quenya|Q]], pron. {{IPA|[aˈrantar]}}; {{TA|185}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 192</ref> – {{TA|435|n}},<ref name="North">{{App|North}}</ref> died aged 250 years) was the fifth [[King of Arnor]].

==History==
Arantar succeeded his father, [[Eldacar (King of Arnor)|Eldacar]], when he died in [[Third Age 339]]. Arantar was the great-grandson of [[Isildur]], last [[High King of the Dúnedain|High King]] of both [[Gondor]] and Arnor.

He ruled uneventfully for ninety-six years, and was succeeded by his son, [[Tarcil]], when he died in [[Third Age 435]].<ref name="North"/>

==Etymology==
''Arantar'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests its means "High King" and is a compound of ''[[aran]]'' ("king") and the affix ''[[tar|-tar]] ("high", "lord").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-981085157.html|articlename=Q. ''Arantar'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 January 2022}}</ref>
